What is the earliest extant transverse flute?	it dates from 433 BC

What is the earliest extant transverse flute?	Chi
When does a flute produce sound?	when a stream of air directed across a hole in the instrument creates a vibration of air at the hole
When does a flute produce sound?	When a stream of air directed across a hole in the instrument creats a vibration of air at the hole.
How can a flute's volume be increased?	a flute's volume can generally be increased by making its resonator and tone holes larger
How can a flute's volume be increased?	A flute's volume can be increased by making its resonator and tone holes larger.
Do open-ended flutes have brighter timbres?	yes
Do open-ended flutes have brighter timbres?	Yes.
Where was the oldest flute ever discovered found?	Germany
Where was the oldest flute ever discovered found?	Various parts of Germany.
Are Western flutes simpler than Indian flutes?	no
Are Western flutes simpler than Indian flutes?	Yes.
Why is a police whistle very wide for its pitch?	A flute's volume can generally be increased by making its resonator and tone holes larger
Why is a police whistle very wide for its pitch?	It's volume is high either because of its larger resonator or larger tone holes.
What are the two main varieties of Indian flutes?	The first, the Bansuri. The second, the Venu or Pullanguzhal
What are the two main varieties of Indian flutes?	Bansuri and the Venu or Pullanguzhal.
Has the flute been dated to prehistoric times?	yes
Has the flute been dated to prehistoric times?	Yes
Was the pan flute used in Greece?	yes
Was the pan flute used in Greece?	Yes
Can a flute be played with several different air sources?	yes

How many main varieties of Indian flutes are currently used?	two
How many main varieties of Indian flutes are currently used?	Two
What material is a chi flute fashioned from?	lacquered bamboo
What material is a chi flute fashioned from?	Lacquered bamboo
How does a flute player change the pitch of the sound?	by opening and closing holes in the body of the instrument
How does a flute player change the pitch of the sound?	Opening and closing holes in the body of the instrument
What is the most basic form of the flute?	a flute can be an open tube which is blown like a bottle
